title: 'World's worst skier' delivers inspiring message
text:
'World's worst skier' delivers inspiring message "I don't plan on being the exception." Post to Facebook 'World's worst skier' delivers inspiring message "I don't plan on being the exception."  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/venezuelan-skier-adrian-solano-inspiring-response-worlds-worst-skier-lahti/   Join the Nation's Conversation   'World's worst skier' delivers inspiring message Andrew Joseph 10:20 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 
Adrian Solano (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Adrian Solano of Venezuela had never trained on snow before. 
He had never even seen snow until he arrived at the Lahti 2017 Nordic World Ski Championships in Finland. According to BBC , Solano spent his time in Venezuela training on wheels. He traveled to France in January with the intention of going to Sweden to learn to ski on snow, but he was deported because French officials did not believe he was skier . 
Remarkably, with no on-snow training, Solano made it to Finland and competed in a cross country skiing qualifier this week. He struggled â€¦ mightily. 
The catastrophic performance turned Solano into an internet joke. He was dubbed " The world's worst skier ," but he still finished the 1.5 km race - in last place . 
Through all that, Solano's attitude remained an inspiration. He posted to Instagram a message of positivity. Feb 22, 2017 at 10:00pm PST 
He wrote (translated from Spanish): 
Even though I didn't know snow and didn't get the opportunity to train here, I'm giving it my best. And well, even the mighty have fallen like I have but got back up and kept fighting. I don't plan on being the exception.
